item.title: Memory Lane: footballers on holiday
item.trailText: June is a time when footballers traditionally have a bit of a break before pre-season training. With some of today’s players using the interlude as an oppportunity to have a lie down in the street, we thought we would have a rummage through the archives to see what the footballers of yesteryear got up to on their downtime
item.standFirst: June is a time when footballers traditionally have a bit of a break before pre-season training. With some of today’s players using the interlude as an oppportunity to have a lie down in the street, we thought we would have a rummage through the archives to see what the footballers of yesteryear got up to on their downtime

displayImages.caption: Derby County players on holiday in Majorca celebrate after learning that they have won the 1971-72 league title. The players were able to go on a short break after completing all their fixtures early, compared to several other clubs, including Liverpool and Leeds United, who could not catch Derby’s points tally Photograph: Millow/Mirrorpix
displayImages.altText: Derby County players on holiday in Majorca celebrate after learning that they have won the 1971-72 league title. cards.title: Tennis / Djokovic teases crowd with shirt at Wimbledon warm-up
cards.rawTitle: Djokovic teases crowd with shirt at Wimbledon warm-up

item.title: Novak Djokovic teases crowd with shirt at Wimbledon warm-up
item.trailText: Novak Djokovic, the world's top tennis player, performs a striptease during a Wimbledon warm-up match against Frenchman Richard Gasquet at Boodles
item.standFirst: Novak Djokovic, the world's top tennis player, performs a striptease during a Wimbledon warm-up match against Frenchman Richard Gasquet at Boodles tennis tournament in Stoke Poges, Buckinghamshire. Playing to the crowd, Djokovic peels off his white shirt in a break between sets, swinging the garment above his head before tossing it to the crowd. Gasquet eventually follows suit, upping the stakes with a courtside kiss

cards.title: The amazing world of sport / Does Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?
cards.rawTitle: Does Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?

item.title: Does Brazilian footballer Roberto Firmino really score a 'no-look' basket with his foot?
item.trailText: New Liverpool striker Roberto Firmino appears to kick a football into a basketball hoop without looking
item.standFirst: New Liverpool striker Roberto Firmino appears to kick a football into a basketball hoop without looking. Firmino, known for his 'no-look' goals in the Bundesliga and Brazil, appears to repeat the trick on a basketball court. But is it real, what do you think? Liverpool confirmed on Wednesday they have signed the 23-year-old forward on a five-year deal for a fee of around £29m

cards.title: Rugby union / Lancaster: England will wait for Cipriani
cards.rawTitle: Lancaster: England will wait for Cipriani

item.title: England will wait for Danny Cipriani, says Stuart Lancaster
item.trailText: England's rugby union coach, Stuart Lancaster, says he is waiting to read the police report on fly-half Danny Cipriani before deciding whether to include him in the England world cup squad
item.standFirst: England's rugby union coach, Stuart Lancaster, says he is waiting to read the police report on fly-half Danny Cipriani before deciding whether to include him in the England world cup squad. Cipriani was was arrested for drink-driving earlier this month and police will finish the report in early August.

cards.title: Baseball / Cubs fan catches ball while holding baby
cards.rawTitle: Cubs fan catches ball while holding baby

item.title: Cubs fan catches baseball with bare hand while holding baby
item.trailText: A Cubs fan who was bottle-feeding a baby makes a casual barehanded catch during a game at Wrigley Field on Tuesday night
item.standFirst: A Chicago Cubs fan who was bottle-feeding a baby makes a casual barehanded catch during a game at Wrigley Field on Tuesday night. Keith Hartley takes the ball over the glove of Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez, who immediately complains about interference. Hartley later said he caught the ball to 'protect' his child

cards.title: Golf / Three-metre sink hole has opened on course in Kansas
cards.rawTitle: Three-metre sink hole has opened on course in Kansas

item.title: Sinkhole opens on Kansas golf course
item.trailText: A three-metre sink hole has opened in a golf course in Kansas
item.standFirst: A three-metre sink hole has opened in a golf course in Kansas. Officials at the Canyon Farms golf course in Lenexa said the hazard appeared on the fairway of the 13th hole last Friday after heavy rain. Much of the course is built on top of a disused limestone mine prompting officials to check for further weak spots

Sasic did have better luck elsewhere, however, scoring from the spot in the first half and heading home from close range in the 78th minute, as a dominant Germany won 4-1 Photograph: Dennis Grombkowski/Bongarts/Getty Images

displayImages.caption: Élodie Thomis, here leaping over South Korea defender Lee Eunmi, was also on the scoresheet as France went on to a 3-0 win.  Photograph: Paul Chiasson/AP
displayImages.altText: Elodie Thomis scored the other goal in France's 3-0 victory
displayImages.cleanCaption: Élodie Thomis, here leaping over South Korea defender Lee Eunmi, was also on the scoresheet as France went on to a 3-0 win.

displayImages.caption: A general view as host nation Canada take on Switzerland at BC Place Stadium in Vancouver Photograph: Matthew Lewis/FIFA via Getty Images
displayImages.altText: A general view as host nation Canada take on Switzerland
displayImages.cleanCaption: A general view as host nation Canada take on Switzerland at BC Place Stadium in Vancouver
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Matthew Lewis/FIFA via Getty Images

displayImages.caption: Switzerland’s keeper Gaëlle Thalmann looks worried as she misses the ball while attempting to punch it away. On this occasion she was lucky it did not end up in the back of the net, but she was beaten in the 52nd minute by a shot from Josée Bélanger Photograph: Rich Lam/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Switzerland's keeper Gaelle Thalmann looks worried as she misses the ball when attempting to punch it away.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Switzerland’s keeper Gaëlle Thalmann looks worried as she misses the ball while attempting to punch it away. On this occasion she was lucky it did not end up in the back of the net, but she was beaten in the 52nd minute by a shot from Josée Bélanger

displayImages.caption: With 12 minutes to go Canada’s keeper Erin McLeod denied Switzerland an equaliser when she pulled off this great close-range save to foil Vanessa Bernauer Photograph: Jeff Vinnick/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Canada's keeper Erin McLeod denies Switzerland an equaliser
displayImages.cleanCaption: With 12 minutes to go Canada’s keeper Erin McLeod denied Switzerland an equaliser when she pulled off this great close-range save to foil Vanessa Bernauer

displayImages.caption: Christine Sinclair, left, celebrates Canada’s 1-0 win Photograph: Darryl Dyck/AP
displayImages.altText: Christine Sinclair, left, celebrates Canada's 1-0 win
displayImages.cleanCaption: Christine Sinclair, left, celebrates Canada’s 1-0 win

displayImages.caption: England goalkeeper Karen Bardsley denied Norway on a number of occasions before she was finally beaten in the 54th minute when Solveig Gulbrandsen nodded Norway into the lead at the near post Photograph: Francois Laplante/FreestylePhoto/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: England goalkeeper Karen Bardsley makes a save
displayImages.cleanCaption: England goalkeeper Karen Bardsley denied Norway on a number of occasions before she was finally beaten in the 54th minute when Solveig Gulbrandsen nodded Norway into the lead at the near post

displayImages.caption: All eyes are on the ball as Steph Houghton’s header finds the net from Fara Williams’s corner to restore parity Photograph: Lars Baron/Fifa via Getty Images
displayImages.altText: All eyes are on the ball as Steph Houghton’s header finds the net
displayImages.cleanCaption: All eyes are on the ball as Steph Houghton’s header finds the net from Fara Williams’s corner to restore parity
displayImages.cleanCredit: Photograph: Lars Baron/Fifa via Getty Images

displayImages.caption: Norway keeper Ingrid Hjelmseth is beaten by Lucy Bronze’s drive from the edge of the box which gave England the lead and a 2-1 win, putting them into the quarter-finals Photograph: Andre Ringuette/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Norway keeper Ingrid Hjelmseth is beaten by Lucy Bronze’s drive
displayImages.cleanCaption: Norway keeper Ingrid Hjelmseth is beaten by Lucy Bronze’s drive from the edge of the box which gave England the lead and a 2-1 win, putting them into the quarter-finals

displayImages.caption: Abby Wambach rises above Colombia’s Orianica Velasquez to clear the ball for the USA Photograph: Mike Sturk/EPA
displayImages.altText: Abby Wambach rises above Colombia’s Orianica Velasquez to clear the ball for the USA
displayImages.cleanCaption: Abby Wambach rises above Colombia’s Orianica Velasquez to clear the ball for the USA

displayImages.caption: Alex Morgan, left, is tripped by Catalina Perez, for which the Colombian keeper was given a red card but Wambach missed the resulting penalty Photograph: Qin Lang/Xinhua Press/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Alex Morgan  is tripped by Catalina Perez
displayImages.cleanCaption: Alex Morgan, left, is tripped by Catalina Perez, for which the Colombian keeper was given a red card but Wambach missed the resulting penalty

displayImages.caption: The USA players and fans celebrate after Morgan opened the scoring. Carli Lloyd doubled their lead to give the USA a 2-0 win Photograph: Mike Sturk/EPA
displayImages.altText: The USA players and fans celebrate after  a 2-0 win
displayImages.cleanCaption: The USA players and fans celebrate after Morgan opened the scoring. Carli Lloyd doubled their lead to give the USA a 2-0 win

displayImages.caption: Holland goalkeeper Loes Geurts has no chance keeping out a 78th-minute missile from Mizuho Sakaguchi. An early strike from Saori Ariyoshi had opened the scoring as Japan dominated the opening half Photograph: Rich Lam/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Holland goalkeeper Loes Geurts has no chance keeping out a 78th-minute missile from Mizuho Sakaguchi
displayImages.cleanCaption: Holland goalkeeper Loes Geurts has no chance keeping out a 78th-minute missile from Mizuho Sakaguchi. An early strike from Saori Ariyoshi had opened the scoring as Japan dominated the opening half

displayImages.caption: Japan’s goalkeeper Ayumi Kaihori is mortified that Kirsten van de Ven’s tame injury-time header somehow found its way past her. But it was too little too late as the defending champions rolled into the last eight with an impressive 2-1 win Photograph: Darryl Dyck/AP
displayImages.altText: Japan's goalkeeper Ayumi Kaihori misses Kirsten van de Ven's tame injury-time header
displayImages.cleanCaption: Japan’s goalkeeper Ayumi Kaihori is mortified that Kirsten van de Ven’s tame injury-time header somehow found its way past her. But it was too little too late as the defending champions rolled into the last eight with an impressive 2-1 win

image.caption: Germany’s Anja Mittag celebrates after opening the scoring against Sweden Photograph: Nicholas Kamm/AFP/Getty Images
image.altText: Germany's Anja Mittag celebrates
image.cleanCaption: Germany’s Anja Mittag celebrates after opening the scoring against Sweden

image.caption: Sweden’s Lotta Schelin shields the ball from Germany’s Saskia Bartusiak Photograph: Jana Chytilova/Getty Images
image.altText: Sweden's Lotta Schelin shields the ball from Germany's Saskia Bartusiak
image.cleanCaption: Sweden’s Lotta Schelin shields the ball from Germany’s Saskia Bartusiak

image.caption: Germany’s Célia Šašić fails to convert a chance due to pressure from Sweden’s Hedvig Lindahl and Amanda Ilestedt. Sasic did have better luck elsewhere, however, scoring from the spot in the first half and heading home from close range in the 78th minute, as a dominant Germany won 4-1 Photograph: Dennis Grombkowski/Bongarts/Getty Images
image.altText: Germany's Celia Sasic fails to convert a chance
image.cleanCaption: Germany’s Célia Šašić fails to convert a chance due to pressure from Sweden’s Hedvig Lindahl and Amanda Ilestedt. Sasic did have better luck elsewhere, however, scoring from the spot in the first half and heading home from close range in the 78th minute, as a dominant Germany won 4-1

image.caption: China’s Wang Shanshan keeps the ball in play and away from Cameroon’s Jeannette Yango. Wang scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute with a classy side-footed volley Photograph: Mike Sturk/EPA
image.altText: China’s Wang Shanshan keeps the ball in play
image.cleanCaption: China’s Wang Shanshan keeps the ball in play and away from Cameroon’s Jeannette Yango. Wang scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute with a classy side-footed volley

image.caption: China’s Wu Haiyan, right, and team-mate Zhao Rong celebrate their 1-0 victory Photograph: Brad Smith/ISI/Corbis
image.altText: China's Wu Haiyan and Zhao Rong celebrate their 1-0 victory
image.cleanCaption: China’s Wu Haiyan, right, and team-mate Zhao Rong celebrate their 1-0 victory

image.caption: But for every winner there’s a loser and Gaëlle Enganamouit shows her disappointment as she leaves the pitch after Cameroon’s defeat Photograph: Geoff Robins/AFP/Getty Images
image.altText: Gaelle Enganamouit reacts as she leaves the pitch after Cameroon's defeat
image.cleanCaption: But for every winner there’s a loser and Gaëlle Enganamouit shows her disappointment as she leaves the pitch after Cameroon’s defeat

image.caption: Brazil’s Marta was shown a yellow card for this tackle on Australia’s Elise Kellond-Knight Photograph: Elsa/Getty Images
image.altText: Brazil's Marta earnt herself a yellow card with this tackle on Australia's Elise Kellond-Knight
image.cleanCaption: Brazil’s Marta was shown a yellow card for this tackle on Australia’s Elise Kellond-Knight

image.caption: The Australian players celebrate in the 80th minute when Kyah Simon sidefooted the ball home after Lisa De Vanna’s shot was fumbled by Brazil’s keeper Luciana Photograph: Andrew Vaughan/AP
image.altText: The Australian players celebrate in the 80th minute after Kyah Simon sidefooted the ball home
image.cleanCaption: The Australian players celebrate in the 80th minute when Kyah Simon sidefooted the ball home after Lisa De Vanna’s shot was fumbled by Brazil’s keeper Luciana

image.caption: The final whistle heralds the tournament’s biggest shock and Australia’s first tournament knockout win, 1-0, over Brazil Photograph: Franck Fife/AFP/Getty Images
image.altText: The final whistle heralds Australia's first tournament win over Brazil
image.cleanCaption: The final whistle heralds the tournament’s biggest shock and Australia’s first tournament knockout win, 1-0, over Brazil
